animals.name: African Elephant
animals.habitat: Savannas, forests, deserts, and marshes across sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore; primarily grasses, leaves, bark, and fruit
animals.description: The African elephant is the largest land animal on Earth, known for its large ears and tusks. They play a crucial role in their ecosystems by modifying habitats and dispersing seeds.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: Lion
animals.habitat: Grasslands, savannas, and open woodlands in sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore; preys on large herbivores like zebras and wildebeests
animals.description: Lions are social big cats known for living in prides. They are apex predators and play a significant role in maintaining the balance of their ecosystems.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: Mountain Gorilla
animals.habitat: Montane forests in the Virunga Mountains of East Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore; feeds on leaves, shoots, and stems
animals.description: Mountain gorillas are a subspecies of eastern gorillas. They live in social groups led by a dominant silverback male and are known for their gentle behavior.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: Giraffe
animals.habitat: Savannas and open woodlands across Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore; primarily feeds on acacia leaves
animals.description: Giraffes are the tallest land animals, recognized by their long necks and legs. They play a vital role in their ecosystems by browsing on tall vegetation.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: Black Rhinoceros
animals.habitat: Savannas, grasslands, and shrublands in eastern and southern Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore; browsers feeding on bushes and trees
animals.description: Black rhinos are known for their hooked upper lip, which aids in feeding on shrubs. They are solitary animals and have faced significant declines due to poaching.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: Cheetah
animals.habitat: Open plains and savannas in sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore; primarily hunts small to medium-sized ungulates
animals.description: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, capable of reaching speeds up to 60-70 mph. They rely on speed and stealth to catch their prey.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)

animals.name: African Wild Dog
animals.habitat: Savannas, grasslands, and open forests in sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore; hunts antelopes, rodents, and birds
animals.description: African wild dogs are highly social and live in packs with complex social structures. They are known for their cooperative hunting techniques.
animals.credit: Information and image source: African Wildlife Foundation (www.awf.org)
